denver.learners¶

denver.learners.base_learner¶

class denver.learners.base_learner.DenverLearner[source]¶

Bases: object

Abstract base class for all downstream task in Denver, such as Sequence Tagger and Text Classification. Every new type of model must implement these methods.

evaluate()[source]¶

Evaluate the model.

predict()[source]¶

Predicts the class labels for the given sample.

process()[source]¶

Predict for a sample and return the rasa format output.

save_model(save_file)[source]¶

Save the model in the save_file path.

train()[source]¶

Training the model.

denver.learners.flair_sequence_tagger_leaner¶

class denver.learners.flair_sequence_tagger_leaner.FlairSequenceTaggerLearner(data_source=None, tag_type='ner', embeddings=None, mode='training', model_path=None, hidden_size=1024, use_rnn=True, rnn_layers=1, dropout=0.0, word_dropout=0.05, locked_dropout=0.5, reproject_embeddings=True, use_crf=True, beta=1)[source]¶

Bases: denver.learners.base_learner.DenverLearner

A class Flair Sequence Tagger Learner.

convert_to_rasa_format(entities)[source]¶

Convert output in rasa’s format

Parameters

entities – List entities from the output of process function.

Returns

A result rasa format. Example:

[{

‘confidence’: confidence,

’end’: end,

’start’: start,

’entity’: entity,

’extractor’: extractor,

’value’: value

}]

evaluate(data=None, text_col='text', label_col='label', lowercase=True, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Evaluate the model with test dataset

Parameters

  • data (Union[str, DataFrame, DenverDataSource, None]) – The path of eval dataset (.csv) or a DataFrame or a DenverDataSource

  • text_col (str) – The column name of text data

  • label_col (str) – The column name of label data

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

Returns

Metrics

{

‘loss’: loss,

’main_score’: main_score,

’detailed_results’: detailed_results,

}

predict(sample, lowercase=True, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False)[source]¶

Predicts the tags for the given sequence sample

Parameters

  • sample (str) – The sample need to predict

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

Returns

Return the predicted tagging

predict_on_df(data, text_col='text', label_col=None, lowercase=True, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Predicts the class labels for a DataFrame or a path to .csv file

Parameters

  • data (Union[str, Path, DataFrame]) – The path to data or a DataFrame or a path to .csv file

  • text_col (str) – The column name of text data

  • label_col (Optional[str]) – The column name of label data

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

Returns

A DataFrame include of columns {‘text’, ‘pred’,’label’(maybe)}.

process(sample, lowercase=True, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False)[source]¶

Return the results as output of rasa format

Parameters

  • sample – The sample need to calculate uncertainty score.

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

Returns

The results format rasa. Example: [{

‘confidence’: 0.9994359612464905,

’end’: 19,

’entity’: ‘object_type’,

’extractor’: ‘FlairSequenceTagger’,

’start’: 16,

’value’: ‘cũi’

}]

train(base_path='./models/', is_save_best_model=True, model_file=None, learning_rate=0.1, batch_size=32, num_epochs=500, skip_save_model=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Training the learner

Parameters

  • base_path (Union[str, Path]) – Main path to models are saved

  • is_save_best_model (bool) – If True save the best model, else save the final model

  • model_file (Optional[str]) – The file name to save the model

  • learning_rate (float) – Initial learning rate

  • batch_size (int) – Size of batches during training

  • num_epochs (int) – The number of epochs to train

  • skip_save_model (bool) – If True, disables saving the model

validate()[source]¶

Evaluate the model with dev dataset

Returns

dev_eval_result: The result.

Returns

dev_loss: The value loss.

Convert outputs in rasa’s format

Parameters

A result rasa format. Example:

[{

‘confidence’: confidence,

’end’: end,

’start’: start,

’entity’: entity,

’extractor’: extractor,

’value’: value

}]

evaluate(data=None, text_col='text', intent_col='intent', tag_col='tag', lowercase=False, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Evaluate the model with test dataset

Parameters

  • data (Union[str, DataFrame, DenverDataSource, None]) – The path to data .csv or a DataFrame or a DenverDataSource

  • text_col (str) – The column name of text data

  • intent_col (str) – The column name of intent label data

  • tag_col (str) – The column name of tags label data

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

Returns

Metrics format:

{

‘precision’: 1.0,

’recall’: 1.0,

’f1-score’: 1.0

}

Returns

A dict {‘intent’: classes of intent, ‘tag’: classes of tag}

predict_on_df(data, text_col='text', intent_col=None, tag_col=None, lowercase=True, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Predicts the class labels for a DataFrame

Parameters

  • data (Union[str, Path, DataFrame]) – The path to data or a DataFrame

  • text_col (str) – The column name of text data

  • intent_col (Optional[str]) – The column name of intent label data

  • tags_col – The column name of tags label data

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

Returns

A DataFrame include of columns ‘text’, ‘pred’, ‘label’(maybe)).

process(sample=None, lowercase=False, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False)[source]¶

Return the results as output of rasa format

Parameters

  • sample (Optional[str]) – The sample need to inference

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

Returns

The results format rasa. Example:

{

“intent”: {

“name”: query_kb,

”confidence”: 0.9999999

},

”entities”: [

{

‘confidence’: 0.9994359612464905,

’end’: 3,

’entity’: ‘object_type’,

’extractor’: ‘OnetNet’,

’start’: 0,

’value’: ‘cũi’

},

],

”text”: cũi này còn k sh

}

train(base_path='./models/', is_save_best_model=True, model_file=None, optimizer='adam', batch_size=64, learning_rate=0.001, num_epochs=50, grad_norm=5.0, patience=75, skip_save_model=False, skip_save_log=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Train and save the model

Parameters

  • base_path (str) – Main path to models are saved

  • is_save_best_model (bool) – If True save the best model, else save the final model

  • model_file (Optional[str]) – The file name to save the model

  • learning_rate (float) – Initial learning rate

  • batch_size (int) – Size of batches during training

  • num_epochs (int) – The number of epochs to train.

  • grad_norm (float) – If provided, gradient norms will be rescaled to have a maximum of this value.

  • patience (int) – Number of epochs to be patient before early stopping: the training is stopped after patience epochs with no improvement. If given, it must be > 0. If None, early stopping is disabled.

  • skip_save_model (bool) – If True, disables saving the model

  • skip_save_log (bool) – If True, disable saving the training log

validate()[source]¶

evaluate(data=None, text_col='text', label_col='label', lowercase=True, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False, with_confusion_matrix=False, save_dir='./evaluation/', save_name='confusion-matrix', **kwargs)[source]¶

Batch evalute the model and storage confustion matrics chart

Parameters

  • data (Union[str, DataFrame, DenverDataSource, None]) – The path to data or a DataFrame

  • text_col (str) – The column name of text data

  • label_col (str) – The column name of label data

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

  • confusion_matrix – If True, save confusion matrix figure

  • save_cm_dir – The path directory to save confusion-matrix’s image

  • save_cm_dir – The file name to save confusion-matrix’s image

Retuns

Metrics format:

{

‘acc’: acc,

‘f1’: f1,

‘precision’: precision,

‘recall’: recall

}

evaluate_by_step(data=None, text_col='text', label_col='label', lowercase=True, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False, with_confusion_matrix=False, save_dir='./evaluation/', save_name='confusion-matrix')[source]¶

Evalute the model and storage confustion matrics chart

Parameters

  • data (Union[str, DataFrame, DenverDataSource, None]) – The path to data (.csv) or a DataFrame or a DenverDataSource

  • text_col (str) – The column name of text data

  • label_col (str) – The column name of label data

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

  • with_confusion_matrix (bool) – If True, save confusion matrix figure

  • save_cm_dir – The path directory to save confusion-matrix’s image

  • save_cm_dir – The file name to save confusion-matrix’s image

Retuns

Metrics format:

{

‘acc’: acc,

‘f1’: f1,

‘precision’: precision,

‘recall’: recall

}

Fit the model on data and learn using learning rate, momentums and number of epochs.

Parameters

  • learning_rate – learning rate

  • moms – A dict momentums rate, use when train model IC with fastai

  • num_epochs (int) – The number of epochs

Freeze up to last layer group.

get_uncertainty_score(sample, lowercase=True, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False, n_times=10)[source]¶

Get uncertainty score of the prediction of a sample.

Parameters

  • sample – The sample need to calculate uncertainty score.

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

  • n_times – The times prediction to calculate uncertainty score.

Returns

Return the value format:

{

‘text’: sample,

’intent’: iclass,

’uncertainty_score’: value,

’method’: method.__name__

}

predict(sample, with_dropout=False, lowercase=True, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False)[source]¶

Predicts the class labels for the given sample

Parameters

  • sample (str) – the sample need to predict

  • with_dropout (bool) – if True, use mc dropout during the predict

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

Returns

Return predicted class, label and probabilities.

predict_on_df(data, text_col='text', label_col=None, lowercase=True, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Batch predicts the class labels for a DataFrame or a path to .csv file

Parameters

  • data (Union[str, Path, DataFrame]) – The path to data or a DataFrame or a path to .csv file

  • text_col (str) – The column name of text data

  • label_col (Optional[str]) – The column name of label data

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

Returns

A DataFrame include of columns {‘text’, ‘pred’, ‘uncertainty_score’}.

predict_on_df_by_step(data, text_col='text', label_col=None, with_dropout=False, with_uncertainty=False, lowercase=True, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Predicts the class labels for a DataFrame or a path to .csv file

Parameters

  • data (Union[str, Path, DataFrame]) – The path to data or a DataFrame or a path to .csv file

  • text_col (str) – The column name of text data

  • label_col (Optional[str]) – The column name of label data

  • with_dropout (bool) – if True, use mc dropout during the predict.

  • with_uncertainty_score – if True, consist of uncertainty score

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

Returns

A DataFrame include of columns {‘text’, ‘pred’, ‘uncertainty_score’}.

predict_with_mc_dropout(sample, lowercase=True, rm_emoji=True, rm_url=True, rm_special_token=False, n_times=10)[source]¶

Predicts the class labels for the given sampels with MC Dropout.

Parameters

  • sample – the sample need to predict

  • lowercase (bool) – If True, lowercase data

  • rm_emoji (bool) – If True, replace the emoji token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_url (bool) – If True, replace the url token into <space> (” “)

  • rm_special_token (bool) – If True, replace the special token into <space> (” “), special token included of punctuation token, characters without vietnamese characters

  • n_times – the times prediction to calculate with MC Dropout.

Returns

Return List predicted class, label and probabilities of n_times times.
